meanings.definition: In a very bright or shining way.
meanings.sent1: The sun shone brilliantly in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The stars sparkled brilliantly on a clear night.
meanings.sent3: The flashlight worked brilliantly in the dark cave.
meanings.sent4: The diamond glittered brilliantly on her finger.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse beacon shone brilliantly, guiding ships safely.

meanings.definition: In a very intelligent or talented way.
meanings.sent1: She solved the puzzle brilliantly and quickly.
meanings.sent2: The scientist explained the theory brilliantly to the students.
meanings.sent3: The detective brilliantly uncovered the hidden clues.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted the portrait brilliantly, capturing every detail.
meanings.sent5: The musician played the piano piece brilliantly, mesmerizing the audience.

meanings.definition: In a very impressive or outstanding way.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks display ended brilliantly with a grand finale.
meanings.sent2: The speech was delivered brilliantly, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed the trick brilliantly, leaving everyone amazed.
meanings.sent4: The athlete finished the race brilliantly, breaking the record.
meanings.sent5: The chef cooked the dish brilliantly, earning a standing ovation.
